summary: This document is a chain of emails between attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP and federal prosecutors regarding a grand jury subpoena issued on July 5, 2019. The emails discuss scheduling meetings, sharing case materials, and negotiating the terms for a potential voluntary interview of a client, who is implicated through phone records showing contact with underage girls.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.role: Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP, Defense Attorney
persons.context: Lead attorney representing a client who received a grand jury subpoena; she is coordinating with federal prosecutors regarding the subpoena and a potential voluntary interview.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.role: Associate Attorney at Winston & Strawn LLP
persons.context: Associate attorney working with Suzanne Jaffe Bloom on the case; she assists with scheduling and communications with the prosecution team.

connections.description: They are attorneys at the same law firm (Winston & Strawn LLP) working together on the defense of a client subpoenaed by the SDNY grand jury.
Bloom is the retained defense attorney for a client who received a grand jury subpoena; the client is implicated by phone records showing contact with underage girls.

events.title: SDNY Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued by the Southern District of New York (SDNY) to an unnamed client of Winston & Strawn LLP.

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The initial date the subpoenaed client was required to appear before the grand jury; this date was adjourned and held in abeyance pending further discussions.

events.title: Meeting Between Defense and Prosecution
events.description: A meeting scheduled between defense attorneys (Bloom and Hudgens) and the federal prosecution team to discuss the subpoena and related evidence.

locations: 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193 (Winston & Strawn LLP office)
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued by the SDNY on July 5, 2019, to an unnamed client represented by Winston & Strawn LLP.
Prosecutors informed the defense that they possess contemporaneous telephone records, including from a cell phone registered to the client, showing numerous contacts with multiple underage girls.
The prosecution and defense were negotiating a potential voluntary interview of the client, holding the original July 24, 2019, grand jury appearance date in abeyance.
The prosecution provided the defense with transcripts of court proceedings and referenced several civil cases related to Jeffrey Epstein as part of their information sharing.
